channel.title: CVE Feed for zephyrproject-rtos -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for zephyrproject-rtos -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-3806|2024-08-03T01:20:58.382Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Inconsistent handling of error cases in bluetooth hci may lead to a double free condition of a network buffer.

item.title: CVE-2022-2993|2024-08-03T00:52:59.943Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: There is an error in the condition of the last if-statement in the function smp_check_keys. It was rejecting current keys if all requirements were unmet.

item.title: CVE-2022-2741|2024-08-03T00:46:04.174Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The denial-of-service can be triggered by transmitting a carefully crafted CAN frame on the same CAN network as the vulnerable node. The frame must have a CAN ID matching an installed filter in the vulnerable node (this can easily be guessed based on CAN traffic analyses). The frame must contain the opposite RTR bit as what the filter installed in the vulnerable node contains (if the filter matches RTR frames, the frame must be a data frame or vice versa).

item.title: CVE-2022-1841|2024-08-03T00:17:00.805Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: In subsys/net/ip/tcp.c , function tcp_flags , when the incoming parameter flags is ECN or CWR , the buf will out-of-bounds write a byte zero.

item.title: CVE-2024-3077|2024-08-01T19:32:42.668Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: An malicious BLE device can crash BLE victim device by sending malformed gatt packet

item.title: CVE-2024-1638|2024-07-29T15:19:42.376Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The documentation specifies that the BT_GATT_PERM_READ_LESC and BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_LESC defines for a Bluetooth characteristic: Attribute read/write permission with LE Secure Connection encryption. If set, requires that LE Secure Connections is used for read/write access, however this is only true when it is combined with other permissions, namely BT_GATT_PERM_READ_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_READ_AUTHEN (for read) or BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_AUTHEN (for write), if these additional permissions are not set (even in secure connections only mode) then the stack does not perform any permission checks on these characteristics and they can be freely written/read.

item.title: CVE-2023-6249|2024-07-05T17:20:57.320Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Signed to unsigned conversion esp32_ipm_send

item.title: CVE-2024-3332|2024-07-03T16:44:28.197Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious BLE device can send a specific order of packet sequence to cause a DoS attack on the victim BLE device

item.title: CVE-2024-3077|2024-06-04T17:31:38.524Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: An malicious BLE device can crash BLE victim device by sending malformed gatt packet

item.title: CVE-2024-1638|2024-02-19T21:19:51.915Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The documentation specifies that the BT_GATT_PERM_READ_LESC and BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_LESC defines for a Bluetooth characteristic: Attribute read/write permission with LE Secure Connection encryption. If set, requires that LE Secure Connections is used for read/write access, however this is only true when it is combined with other permissions, namely BT_GATT_PERM_READ_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_READ_AUTHEN (for read) or BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_AUTHEN (for write), if these additional permissions are not set (even in secure connections only mode) then the stack does not perform any permission checks on these characteristics and they can be freely written/read.

item.title: CVE-2023-6881|2024-06-04T17:17:04.296Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Possible buffer overflow in is_mount_point

item.title: CVE-2023-6249|2024-02-18T07:27:13.399Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Signed to unsigned conversion esp32_ipm_send

item.title: CVE-2023-6749|2024-02-18T07:04:36.321Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Unchecked length coming from user input in settings shell

item.title: CVE-2023-7060|2024-06-04T17:17:29.040Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Zephyr OS IP packet handling does not properly drop IP packets arriving on an external interface with a source address equal to 127.0.01 or the destination address.

item.title: CVE-2023-5779|2024-02-18T07:46:41.927Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: can: out of bounds in remove_rx_filter function

item.description: The documentation specifies that the BT_GATT_PERM_READ_LESC and BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_LESC defines for a Bluetooth characteristic: Attribute read/write permission with LE Secure Connection encryption. If set, requires that LE Secure Connections is used for read/write access, however this is only true when it is combined with other permissions, namely BT_GATT_PERM_READ_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_READ_AUTHEN (for read) or BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_AUTHEN (for write), if these additional permissions are not set (even in secure connections only mode) then the stack does not perform any permission checks on these characteristics and they can be freely written/read.
